title: 106_hr4945
content: The Small Business Competition Preservation Act of 2000 may be cited as the act. It includes provisions for a database, analysis, and annual report on bundled contracts. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include a new subsection (p) regarding bundled contracts. This subsection defines bundled contracts and requires the establishment of a database within 180 days of enactment. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration will develop and maintain a database with information on bundled contracts and small businesses displaced as prime contractors. For bundled contracts to be recompeted, the Administrator will analyze savings achieved and determine if they will continue. The Small Business Administration will provide annual reports on contract bundling to the Committees on Small Business, including an analysis of savings achieved and the potential benefits of dividing procurement requirements into separate solicitations for small businesses. The Small Business Administration will provide annual reports on contract bundling to the Committees on Small Business, including data on small business concerns displaced as prime contractors due to bundled contracts by Federal agencies and activities related to previously bundled contracts. The Small Business Administration will report on contract bundling, including justification, cost savings, and projected savings from maintaining bundled requirements. The Small Business Administration will report on contract bundling compliance with small business subcontracting plans and the impact of bundling on small business concerns. The Small Business Administration will report on contract bundling compliance with small business subcontracting plans and the impact of bundling on small business concerns, including any changes to the proportion of small business concerns in related industries. The House of Representatives passed the bill on September 20, 2000.
